plants.name: Chrysanthemum spp.
plants.description: Chrysanthemums are hardy perennials known for their vibrant, daisy-like flowers. They bloom profusely in autumn, adding brilliant colors to gardens as temperatures cool down. Often cultivated, they come in a variety of shapes and sizes.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, especially Asia, North America, and Europe
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums are sometimes called 'mums' and are symbols of longevity and rejuvenation in many cultures, especially in Japan.

plants.name: Hamamelis virginiana
plants.description: A deciduous shrub native to eastern North America, witch hazel produces unique spidery, fragrant yellow flowers in late fall, often after leaves have dropped, adding color to otherwise bare woods.
plants.funFact: The plantâ€™s extract is commonly used for medicinal and skincare purposes due to its astringent properties.

plants.name: Brassica oleracea (Autumn flowering cultivars)
plants.description: Ornamental kale is grown for its broad, ruffled leaves which mature to brilliant shades of purple, pink, and white during cool autumn weather. It can be considered a flowering plant due to its floral beginnings and is popular in fall gardens.
plants.location: Cultivated widely in temperate climates worldwide
plants.funFact: Though typically grown as a leaf vegetable, ornamental kale is prized in horticulture for its vibrant, colorful foliage rather than its flowers.

plants.name: Clitoria ternatea
plants.description: A tropical vine producing striking deep blue flowers with a unique shape resembling a butterfly. It blooms year-round in tropical climates but is especially prolific in late summer and autumn months in appropriate zones.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropics, peaking in late summer to autumn
plants.location: Tropical Asia, parts of Africa, and tropical Americas
plants.funFact: Butterfly pea flowers are used to make a natural blue tea which changes color based on pH when lemon is added.
